temples.history:
The Idaho Falls Idaho Temple was the first temple built in Idaho and is l,ocated on the picturesque banks of the Snake River on 1000 Memorial Drive.
Announced on March 3, 1937
Groundbreaking on December 19, 1939
Dedicated on September 23, 1945
Rededicated on June 4, 2017

temples.history:
The Anchorage Alaska Temple was one of the first three temples announced in 1997 after President Gordon B. Hinckley introduced the smaller temple concept.
Announced on October 4, 1997
Groundbreaking on April 17, 1998
Dedicated on January 9, 1999
Rededicated on February 8, 2004

temples.history:
The Bern Switzerland Temple, the first in Europe, was dedicated in 1955 and remodeled in 1992. The Swiss temple reaches a 60-year milestone in September. The Bern Switzerland Temple, the first in Europe.
Announced July 1, 1952
Groundbreaking August 5, 1953
Dedicated September 11, 1955
Rededicated October 23, 1992

temples.history:
The São Paulo Brazil Temple was the first temple built in South America (and in Brazil). Announced on March 1, 1975
Groundbreaking on March 20, 1976
Dedicated on October 30, 1978
Rededicated on February 22, 2004

temples.name: Manhattan New York Temple
temples.address: 125 Columbus Ave, Fourth Floor, New York, NY, 10023-6514, United States
temples.email: Log in to churchofjesuschrist.org to send email
temples.services:
Clothing rental available
No cafeteria available
No patron housing available
Distribution center nearby
temples.history:
The Manhattan New York Temple was the third temple built from an existing building, following the Vernal Utah Temple (1997) and the Copenhagen Denmark Temple (2004). The temple is virtually a building within a building, which is completely soundproofed from the hustle and bustle of the City. The original building was a multipurpose stake center built in 1976. Announced August 7, 2002
Groundbreaking September 23,2002
Dedicated June 13, 2004
